page_analysis.text_content:
Noise-producing equipment site planning

• May not be located in front, rear, or interior-side yards.
• May encroach into street-side yard up to 6' (Fig 27 C below)
• All service equip. must meet the City's Noise Ordinance in Chapter 9.10 of
  the Municipal Code.
• Replacement of equipment shall conform to this section where feasible.
• Must be insulated and housed, however, Planning Dept. can waive this
  requirement if equipment is located in buildable area and a combination
  of noise specifications, location, and/or other screening or buffering will
  assure compliance with the City's Noise Ordinance at the nearest lot line.

Fig 27 Examples of site planning solutions for noise-producing equipment

A Pool equipment
• Pool equip. is within buildable area even though
  there is room for it behind the
  garage/poolhouse in the required rear yard.
• Air conditioning equip. is located in an out-of-
  theway niche maintaining the required 10' min.
  clearance for the driveway

B Pool equipment & AC unit
• Pool equip. is located within buildable area even
  though there is room for it next to the poolhouse
  in the required rear yard.
• Air conditioning equip. is located within build-
  able area behind the house. There is not enough
  room along the interior side of the house.

C Generator & AC unit
• Air conditioning equip. is located in street
  side yard in compliance with the regula-
  tions. Note that it may not encroach into
  the front or rear yards.
• Generator is located within buildable area.

visual_elements.description: Figure 27 contains three site plan diagrams labeled A, B, and C, illustrating placement rules for noise-producing equipment, along with a key. The diagrams show property layouts with lot lines, setbacks, dwellings, and various types of equipment.
visual_elements.location: Middle and bottom of the page

visual_elements.description: Diagram A, titled 'Pool equipment', shows a lot with a 'Main dwelling' and a 'Combo garage / small poolhouse' in the rear yard. Pool equipment ('P') is in the buildable area near the poolhouse. An AC unit ('AC') is in a niche in the interior-side yard, with a labeled '10' min. clear.' distance from the driveway.

Diagram B, titled 'Pool equipment & AC unit', shows a lot with a 'Main dwelling' and a '2-car attached garage'. A 'Larger poolhouse' is in the rear yard. Pool equipment ('P') is in the buildable area next to the pool. An AC unit ('AC') is located in the buildable area behind the main house.

Diagram C, titled 'Generator & AC unit', shows a corner lot with a 'Main dwelling' and 'Garage'. A generator ('G') is in the buildable area in the rear yard. An AC unit ('AC') is in the 'Street-side yard', with a labeled '6' max.' encroachment from the dwelling. The diagram shows a curb and sidewalk along the front and street-side yards.

A 'Key' or legend on the right side of the page defines the symbols used in the diagrams. It includes: Curb (solid line), Lot line (short dashed line), Sidewalk (tiled rectangle), Required setbacks (long dashed line), Buildable area (dashed outline with light gray fill), Dwelling/parking (solid dark gray fill), 'P' for Pool equip., 'AC' for Air conditioning equip., and 'G' for Generator.
visual_elements.location: Right side of the page, aligned with the diagrams

technical_specifications.parameter: Maximum encroachment from dwelling in street-side yard

subheadings: Fig 27 Examples of site planning solutions for noise-producing equipment

additional_notes: The page number '33' is located at the bottom right corner.
The document is a clean, high-quality digital image or photocopy with no handwritten annotations, stamps, or significant quality degradation.
